# GitHub Repository Polish Checklist

Before sharing with recruiters:

## Repository Settings
- [ ] Public visibility
- [ ] Add description: "Advanced BigQuery analytics for wearable physiological data"
- [ ] Add topics: `bigquery`, `sql`, `data-analytics`, `product-management`, `wearables`, `python`
- [ ] Add website link (if you have portfolio)
- [ ] Pin this repository to your profile

## README Quality
- [ ] Compelling opening (business context, not just "This is a project...")
- [ ] Visual badges (BigQuery, Python, Cost: $0)
- [ ] Clear architecture diagram
- [ ] Key metrics/achievements upfront
- [ ] Business value explained
- [ ] Technology stack listed
- [ ] Sample insights with code
- [ ] Setup instructions
- [ ] Links to detailed docs
- [ ] Professional formatting
- [ ] No typos

## Documentation
- [ ] All SQL files have header comments
- [ ] Python files have docstrings
- [ ] Mermaid diagrams render correctly
- [ ] Links between docs work
- [ ] No broken references

## Code Quality
- [ ] No hardcoded credentials
- [ ] No sensitive data in repo
- [ ] .gitignore properly configured
- [ ] Consistent naming conventions
- [ ] Comments where needed (not obvious code)

## Portfolio Presentation
- [ ] README tells a story (problem â†’ solution â†’ impact)
- [ ] Demonstrates PM skills (not just engineering)
- [ ] Shows business thinking
- [ ] Quantified results ($0 cost, 100x faster, etc.)
- [ ] Professional tone
- [ ] Screenshots or diagrams
- [ ] Contact information

## Final Checks
- [ ] Clone to fresh directory and test setup guide
- [ ] View on GitHub (does it look good?)
- [ ] Test all hyperlinks
- [ ] Read README as if you're a recruiter
- [ ] Share with friend for feedback
